meta.content:
NOTICE:
Due to the COVID-19 virus, the Damar Charter Academy Board Meeting originally scheduled for Wednesday, April 22, 2020 will not be held. Operations information will be provided to Board members for their information and review. Information provided to the Board will be posted on our website after 4-22-20. If you have comments, questions or concerns

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_1 fusion-builder-column-1 fusion-one-full fusion-column-first fusion-column-last 1_1

div.p: Due to the COVID-19 virus, the Damar Charter Academy Board Meeting originally scheduled for Wednesday, April 22, 2020 will not be held. Operations information will be provided to Board members for their information and review. Information provided to the Board will be posted on our website after 4-22-20. If you have comments, questions or concerns you would like addressed immediately or at the next meeting (schedule for June 24th) please submit them to info@damarcharteracademy.org. Thank you for your understanding during this challenging time.

div.h5:
Damar Charter Academy successfully prepares
students with developmental, intellectual, and
behavioral challenges for a lifetime of learning.

div.h5: THE CONFIDENCE TO BE WHO HE IS
div.p: Before Chris Faulkner came to Damar Charter Academy, his behavior problems made it hard for him to be in school. After a few years at DCA, though, school became one of the places he loved to be.
Once Ashsai Webb’s family realized the difference Damar Charter Academy was making in her life, they decided that nothing would keep her from attending … not even a 90-minute commute.
